discourse_list.title: [Informal Poll] DAI borrowing incentive ideas that the DAO could test?

content.content: The bear market has caused a an incredible amount of ETH/BTC vaults to be liquidated, leading to only 5-10% of total ETH vaults and 10-15% of total BTC vaults to remain active (based on MCD Vaults Tracker). Additionally, based on the latest financials provided here, there is only 1 million of recurring lending annual interest income projected based on existing vault usage. To combat this, I am putting together an informal poll to generate ideas on how the protocol can recuperate some TLV and revenue.  The below would be for new wallets/users only with the exception of the referral rewards option, which is my favorite given word of mouth IMO is the best client acquisition strategy. Voting is anonymous and will be aggregated with other member’s votes. The poll will close at July 1st 11:59pm ET, I will summarize the responses in the comment section.    Ideas that the DAO should test to incentivize DAI borrowing? (New Wallets Only)  0% Stability Fee for 90 - 180 days (for ETH, BTC, etc) 0% Liquidation Fee if Liquidation occurs within 90 - 180 days (for ETH, BTC, etc) 5% MKR rewards for 90 - 180 days (Capped at X amount) 5% DSR for 30 - 90 days (Capped at X amount) Referral Rewards via 30 - 90 days of 0% stability fee for every new wallet that opens a vault using their referral code None of the above - Please insert idea in comments     0 voters
content.GPT-summary: The author of the post is asking for feedback on how to incentivize DAI borrowing. They have provided a list of ideas and are asking for additional suggestions. The post also includes information on the current state of ETH/BTC vaults and recurring lending annual interest income. Some voters have provided constructive criticism and asked questions about the proposed ideas.

content.content: Really appreciate the initiative and there are some good ideas here. Fundamentally, Maker can escape the trap of being anchored to the price of BTC/ETH by managing its balance sheet more actively (e.g. investing in US-Treasuries) and expanding the scope of its lending activities to collateral types that have lower correlation to the price of crypto assets (e.g. wholesale real-world lending, see Dune chart below)  image1920×1096 74.5 KB  This would allow Maker to reenable the DSR for e.g. which could also trigger a virtuous loop of Dai demand and new minting demand.

content.content: Lower stability fee seems to be fitting for the current environment. That will stimulate more borrowing

Definitely, the NII increase from investing into bonds and RWA will probably help MakerDAO’s products become more attractive (i.e. increase DAI demand) via increased DSR, decreased stability/liquidation fee, MKR burn or any other DAO enhancements but promotions help attract new customers via “eye-catching” opportunities with the idea of making them longer-term DAI holders which would feed right into your balance sheet initiatives.

content.content: Not sure if it was what you meant but I kind of like the idea of giving some MKR to DAI holders…It kind of makes them more invested in the whole ecosystem.  That said, we would need to think about how to prevent these things from being gamed.  How do you stop people from making their own vaults for referral promotions?  What about closing old vaults and reopening them after the reward period so they can get a new promotion with the same funds? Anyway, it would be interesting to experiment with these things.  But even if you are successful with borrowing promotions, you’ll eventually need holders for generated DAI so the path we’re on to be able to increase DSR permanently is most important.

content.content: Traster_Tray:  That said, we would need to think about how to prevent these things from being gamed.   Thats really interesting, will be tough because of the industry but deadlines and fees would be a a possible deterrant or maybe something around wallet creation dates. In any case, if the promotion leads to an increase in activity it would be a win I believe. Also, totally agree on the priority should be NII for assets via bond investing. Even that though lets say we are able to make 2-3% on a portion of PSM (500M of 3.5B) that may translate to 0.25-1% interest on DSR which although respectable may not be enough to incetivize new DAI holders.
